image.altText: A serious young woman, red hair tied up, pink jumper, holds a baby with ribbon in red hair, fridge behind, with magnets.

items.synopsis: A year after dozens of women launched a complaint about their treatment while giving birth at this regional hospital, more are coming forward to share their "traumatic" experiences.

title.children: Natalie felt like she was being 'tortured' while giving birth. She has joined other women to push for changeÂ

image.altText: Jonny Bairstow carries a protestor off the ground

items.synopsis: After the drama of Edgbaston, the Ashes heads to Lord's for the second Test of the series with Australia holding a crucial 1-0 lead. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

title.children: Protesters halt play early on day one of second Ashes Test at Lord's

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Just Stop Oil protesters have run out before the second over and chucked some orange powder near the bowlers' run-up. Jonny Bairstow CARRIED one from the centre of the field over the boundary. And he's had to go off the field to change his kit. The groundskeepers get the leafblower out to disperse some of the powder. What a bizarre start.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Protesters on the pitch and Jonny Bairstow's carried one off the field

props.alt: Ben Stokes grabs a protester. David Warner looks scared. Jonny Bairstow carries a person in the background.

children.content: Just Stop Oil protesters have run out before the second over and chucked some orange powder near the bowlers' run-up.
Jonny Bairstow CARRIED one from the centre of the field over the boundary. And he's had to go off the field to change his kit.

props.alt: England wicketkeeper Jonny Bairstow carries a protester, with his arm raised, off the field.

children.content: The groundskeepers get the leafblower out to disperse some of the powder.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: England has won the toss and put Australia in to bat. There are clouds overhead and the pitch has a green tinge to it, so they are hoping to rip through the Aussie top order in quick order. Meanwhile, Australia has made one major change, with Scott Boland out and Mitchell Starc coming into the bowling attack. Australia captain Pat Cummins says he would have bowled first as well if he'd won the toss, and says Starc has come in to add a bit of variety.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: England to bowl first as Australia makes a major change

props.alt: Australia bowler Mitchell Starc runs on the field in the warm-up.

children.content: England has won the toss and put Australia in to bat.
There are clouds overhead and the pitch has a green tinge to it, so they are hoping to rip through the Aussie top order in quick order.
Meanwhile, Australia has made one major change, with Scott Boland out and Mitchell Starc coming into the bowling attack.
Australia captain Pat Cummins says he would have bowled first as well if he'd won the toss, and says Starc has come in to add a bit of variety.

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie.

items.synopsis: The ex-husband of a former owner of a Canberra lobbying firm has used parliamentary privilege to make explosive claims that it planned to offer kickbacks to former Liberal minister Stuart Robert in return for support to win contracts.

title.children: Lobbying firm allegedly planned to funnel money to Stuart Robert in return for favours, former employee claims

image.altText: Elly looking distressed

items.synopsis: A Melbourne court hearsÂ one of convicted paedophile Malka Leifer's victims lost herÂ baby during the trial into the former principal'sÂ child sexual abuse, as she and her sister detail how the impact of their abuse left them "utterly broken".

title.children: Victim of paedophile principal Malka Leifer reveals loss of baby days before verdict

image.altText: A graphic showing a piggy bank with coins, notes and gold dollar signs going into or out of it.

items.synopsis: The Parliamentary Budget Office releases a sophisticated "build your own budget" interactive.

title.children: Think you could be treasurer? Try this 'build your own budget' interactive

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

items.synopsis: The latest monthly consumer price indicator shows inflation fell sharply to 5.6 per cent over the 12 months to May, down from 6.8 per cent in April.

title.children: Inflation falls sharply, 'soft enough to see the RBA halt' rate rises

image.altText: Road workers stand on an empty highway cordoned off with traffic cones.

items.synopsis: A teenageÂ girl is under police guard in hospital after allegedly being behind the wheel of a crash in northern Victoria that has left a female passenger dead.

title.children: Charges expected to be laid after 14yo female driver is allegedly involved in fatal collision

image.altText: Scaffolding and a tunnel with train tracks in it.

items.synopsis: The ABC has been given exclusive access to one of five new underground stations being built as part of the Metro Tunnel Project. Despite some cost overruns and controversy, test trains are expected to start running later this year.

title.children: Take a sneak peek at one of Melbourne's new underground train stations

image.altText: A baby wearing a white headband receives kisses on the cheek from her mother and father on each side.

items.synopsis: South KoreansÂ become aÂ year or two younger todayÂ as new laws that require using only the international method of counting age take effect, replacing the country's traditional method.

title.children: South Koreans become one year younger today

image.altText: Bill Shorten at a press conference

items.synopsis: Stressing that no current NDIS participants will be removed from the scheme, NDIS Minister Bill Shorten says reforms to the scheme may lead to fewer future entrants with psychosocial disability, as the government seeks to curb growth by 27,000 over the next few years.

title.children: Fewer people with psychosocial disability may be added to NDIS, as minister flags 27,000 to be diverted under reforms

image.altText: A parked car on fire with flames and smoke coming out late at night in France

items.synopsis: A 17-year-old boyÂ who worked as a delivery driverÂ has beenÂ shot dead by police during a traffic stop, sparking anger and unrest.

title.children: Protesters clash with police in Paris after teenager shot dead

image.altText: A headshot of a young woman with blonde hair looking off camera

items.synopsis: A Belgian tourist missing in Tasmania is described as an "inexperienced hiker", as police continue to search a forest where she is thought to have become lost days ago.

title.children: Weather 'challenging' efforts to find missing Belgian tourist in Tasmania

image.altText: A man standing next to a burnt out car, at night.

items.synopsis: The footage shows the man tellingÂ police to "take [him] to prison" for setting aÂ car on fire and threateningÂ to light up a petrol station. But responding officersÂ "just missedÂ the red flags"Â and did not arrest him, the NT coroner has heard.

title.children: DV inquest shown body-worn footage of killer, hours before fatal attack

image.altText: Hans Niemann

items.synopsis: A US federal court judge rejectsÂ Hans Niemann's claims Magnus Carlsen and Chess.com broke antitrust laws by colluding to exclude him from lucrative tournaments.

title.children: US court dismisses Hans Niemann's $150m defamation lawsuit against fellow chess star Magnus Carlsen

image.altText: A composite picture of Veronica Philomena Lockyer and her seven-month-old baby Adell Sherylee Partridge.

items.synopsis: It's been 25 years since Veronica Lockyer and her baby daughterÂ vanished without trace on the outskirts of Perth, and now anÂ inquestÂ is trying to piece together the mystery.Â

title.children: What happened to Veronica and baby Adell? Coroner probes 25-year-old WA cold case mystery

items.synopsis: A young woman who spat at and punched staff at the Hindley Street McDonald's in Adelaide's CBD in OctoberÂ has been sentenced to an 18-month good-behaviour bond.

title.children: 'Maccas spitter' first person to be sentenced under harsher retail assault laws in SA

image.altText: map of offshore wind farm zone planned for southern ocean

items.synopsis: Climate Change and Energy Minister Chris Bowen says an offshore wind zone in the Southern Ocean will help unlock "cheaper, cleaner" energy security.

title.children: Vic, SA offshore wind zone could power 8.4m homes, give jobs to 6,000

image.altText: aerial image of former saleyards in ballarat

items.synopsis: Victoria's opposition raises concerns about theÂ safety of the former Ballarat saleyards, which will be transformed into an athletes' village for the 2026 Commonwealth Games.

title.children: Victoria's opposition flags contamination concerns for Commonwealth Games athletes' village site

image.altText: Three-year-old William Tyrrell has been missing from his NSW mid north coast home since late last week.

items.synopsis: The foster mother is maintaining she has nothing to do with William's disappearance as detectives ask the public prosecutor to consider charges relating to hiding the toddler's body.

title.children: William Tyrrell's foster mother demands to see all evidence against her after police recommend charges

image.altText: An orca jumps out of the ocean with mountains in the background

items.synopsis: A pod of orcas swims into the bay at Merimbula, including one that has been sighted on and off for 20Â years.

title.children: 'Holy grail' of whale watching captured right next to the NSW coastline

image.altText: Two brown cows

items.synopsis: New research shows a 65 per centÂ carbon emissions reduction in the industry since 2005 but a lot more investment will be needed if the sector is going to reach its carbon neutral target by 2030.

title.children: Red meat sector's target of net zero emissions is 'ambitious' and needs 'more investment'

image.altText: Sydney gay hate murders

items.synopsis: An inquiry into suspected unsolved deaths suspected of being gay hate crimes has heard NSW Police sought to discredit a coroner's finding that the deaths of three men in Bondi in the 1980s was likely murder.

title.children: Police deliberately refused to investigate Bondi deaths as gay hate crimes, inquiry told

image.altText: An alleged Australian-built cardboard drone lies nose down with a twig stuck in it

items.synopsis: Photos appear online purporting to show an Australian-made drone that recently crashed inside Russian territory with an explosive strapped to it.

title.children: Pro-Putin military bloggers claim Australian-built cardboard drone was brought down inside Russia

image.altText: A composite image shows an older white man in a suit on the left and a younger white man not wearing a suit on the right.

items.synopsis: Pat Sajak will host Wheel of Fortune's upcoming season, the show's 41st,Â before Ryan Seacrest kicks off a multi-year deal starting with season 42.

title.children: Ryan Seacrest announced as new US host of Wheel of Fortune, replacing Pat Sajak

image.altText: A feral cat lying on the ground snarling at the camera.

items.synopsis: A deadly new tool is being rolled out that will kill feral catsÂ by spraying them with a toxic gel, as part of a five-year plan to reduce the enormous impact the predators are havingÂ onÂ native wildlife.Â

title.children: Deadly tool that sprays feral cats with toxic gel unveiled as part of Australia-first strategy to save wildlife

image.altText: A woman lifts a tennis trophy in triumph.

items.synopsis: The governing body for women's tennis announces a new circuit structure designed to ensure equal prize money for men and women by 2027.

title.children: WTA announces plan towards equal pay for men's and women's circuits by 2027

image.altText: Two WA Police forensic officers in protective clothing take photographs of a bag and other items on train tracks.

items.synopsis: Drugs including MDMA, ketamine and cocaine were seized by police at the four-day music event.

title.children: More than 50 charged after $400,000 worth of drugs seized at 'secretive' bush rave in rural Queensland

image.altText: A close-up of a man's face as he leaves court

items.synopsis: Dylan Brown was charged with five counts of sexual touching without consent. In court today, he pleaded guilty to two of the charges while the remaining three were dropped by police.

title.children: NRL star had '15-20 alcoholic drinks' before groping woman in Sydney pub, court told

image.altText: A mural of SA Police officers.

items.synopsis: A new mural in Adelaide's CBD depicting two police officers on duty has been labelled a "misstep" by a state MP.Â

title.children: Mural in Adelaide's CBD labelled 'misstep' as SA Police refuse to outline cost
